title: Zillow Approves Dividend, Creates C Class of Stock
text:
Zillow Approves Dividend, Creates C Class of Stock Company says move enables it to maintain flexibility to issue shares for strategic business decisions By angela.chen@wsj.com July 21, 2015 4:57 p.m. ET 
Zillow Group Inc. approved a dividend Tuesday that will issue nonvoting Class C capital stock to its existing shareholders. 
Shares, which have fallen 22% this year through Mondayâ€™s close, fell about 1% in after-hours trading. 
On Aug. 14, shareholders will receive a dividend of two shares of Class C stock for each share of Class A and... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Popular on WSJ
